description:
The button appeared out of nowhere. There weren't any signs NOT to push it... so the solution is obvious, right? Is it a trap or the start of something new and exciting? The crews of Re:Zero, Overlord, Konosuba, and The Saga of Tanya the Evil will find out when they go from their world to another and get stuck in... class?! See what adorable chaos they'll get up to in this collection of shorts!

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Skeleton
tags.description: Prominently features skeleton(s) as a character.

tags.name: Succubus
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a succubus, a creature in medieval folklore that typically uses their sexual prowess to trap and seduce people to feed off them.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

[Website (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/yukiaoi) | [Website (FlyingDog)](https://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/flyingdog/-/Artist/A023992.html) | [Profile (Aoni Pro)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/yuki-aoi.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/staff_aoi/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aoiyuki_official/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Yūki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/悠木碧)

Aoi Yabusaki, better known by her stage name Aoi Yuuki, is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer represented by Pro-Fit.

Yuuki entered the entertainment industry at the age of four. As a child, she acted in films and dramas. From 1999 to 2002, she made regular appearances on the variety shows Appare Sanma Dai-sensei and Yappari Sanma Dai-sensei which aired on Fuji TV. When she was in fifth grade, she made her debut as a voice actress as [Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/15429/) on [Kino's Journey](https://anilist.co/anime/486/).

In late 2006, she was affiliated with the theater company Central. After her admission to high school in August 2007, she joined the agency Breath, whilst changing her stage name to Aoi Yuuki. In 2008, she got her first major role in [Kure-nai](https://anilist.co/anime/3358/) as [Murasaki Kuhouin](https://anilist.co/character/10174/). In August of the same year, she moved to the agency Pro-Fit.

In October 2011, she won the Newtype award for best lead voice actress for her role as [Madoka Kaname](https://anilist.co/character/37832/) in [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/). She was also awarded for Best Lead Actress in the 6th Seiyuu Awards for Madoka Kaname, [Victorique de Blois](https://anilist.co/character/20170/) and [Tooru Ichii](https://anilist.co/character/38904/).

In 2013, Yuuki and [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996/) formed the singing unit [petit milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523).

**Non-anime voice roles:** 
- [Lumine](https://anilist.co/character/209682/Ying) - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Gwen Stacy - Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (Movie); Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse (Movie)

He is a voice actor and narrator who is affiliated with Arts Vision.
Not to be confused with [Jun Fukuyama (福山潤)](https://anilist.co/staff/95086).

[Profile](https://www.artsvision.co.jp/talent/14317/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/yyg-48/) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jun_Fukushima) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%A6%8F%E5%B3%B6%E6%BD%A4)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/maruyama_kugane)
[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yumi_hara.0121/)

__Height:__ 160 cm

[Website](http://www.amamiyasora.jp/) | [Profile](http://musicrayn.com/amamiya_sora) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/amamiyasorablog/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc4xpujLxnUBSI1XX-SdldQ) | [Second YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2oaLFNojVzLwQaA5KJOy3g) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Amamiyastaff) 

While a sophomore in high school, Amamiya was introduced to a video collection of roles of voice actress [Miyuki Sawashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/95099). Following this, Amamiya decided to become a voice actress.

Amamiya, together with [Momo Asakura](https://anilist.co/staff/118479) and [Shiina Natsukawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118818), passed an audition held by Music Ray'n in 2011, with the three making their voice acting debut in 2012. She made her official music debut for Music Ray'n by performing Akame ga Kill's opening theme "Skyreach." In late 2014, Amamiya, Asakura, and Natsukawa formed the music unit [TrySail](https://anilist.co/staff/144938/), which released its first single "Youthful Dreamer," used as the opening theme to the anime television series Ultimate Otaku Teacher, on May 13, 2015.

Amamiya, together with [Reina Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/118602) and [Aya Suzaki](https://anilist.co/staff/114834), received the Best New Actress award at the 9th Seiyu Awards in March 2015.

[Blog](http://dnacrobat.blog.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/neichiru) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=77203)

**[Website](http://koshiandoh.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/koshiandoh)**

Currently residing in Saitama, Japan.
 
[Blog](http://natsumeakatsuki.blog.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akatsukioffici3)

[Website](http://ashina.info/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minopu)

Minoru Ashina is a Japanese anime director and veterinarian.

[Twitter](https://x.com/sonzaix) | [Note](https://note.com/sonzaix) | [Blog](http://sonzaix.blog.fc2.com) | [Syosetu](https://mypage.syosetu.com/mypage/profile/userid/278115)

Zen released ['Youjo Senki'](https://anilist.co/manga/94846/Youjo-Senki/) the 31th of October 2013, which jumpstarted their career due to the success of the light novel. The series would later be adapted to [manga](https://anilist.co/manga/97216/Youjo-Senki/), [anime](https://anilist.co/anime/21613/Youjo-Senki/) and a [movie](https://anilist.co/anime/100878/Youjo-Senki-Movie/). The novel and manga are being translated into English by [Yen Press](https://yenpress.com/series/the-saga-of-tanya-the-evil-manga).

The author also participated in scenario writing for the game adaptation of  __'Chaos Dragon: Chaos War'__ and the original story creator of __'Jyūma no Reza Nation'__.

They love Humanities and Social Science, especially when associated with International Relations and History, which might have played a huge role in the creation of Youjo Senki in the first place. They're a huge fan of simulation and strategy games, especially Paradox Interactive's. They're also a [Toshiya Wakabayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/119353/Toshiya-Wakabayashi) fan, the original creator of [Tsurezure Children](https://anilist.co/anime/98291/Tsurezure-Children/).

The author often jokingly says they're not good at deadlines or they're a pastafarian and caffeine addict.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/otsuka_shin)

**Height:** 170 cm
**Skills:** English, kendo (1st dan)
**Agency:** Axl-One

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/satoshi-hino) | [Profile](http://www.axl-one.com/talent/hino.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hino_Satoshi_84) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hino_satoshi_84)

Married to voice actress [Saki Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/95329/Saki-Nakajima). He has also voiced many non-anime roles like Benjamin Hornigold in _Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag_ (video game), Cedric Diggory in _Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire_ (Hollywood film), and Ron Stoppable in _Kim Possible_ (American cartoon).

Non-anime roles;
-Phainon (Honkai: Star Rail)
-Kevin Kaslana (Honkai Impact 3rd)
-Hung (Arknights)
